Title: N/A

reviewText: .......I am still trying to figure that one out.TNAOOC has got to be one of the funniest sitcoms ever made. Everything works and clicks. JLD, previously Elaine on Seinfeld, IMHO, is even funnier than Lucille Ball, she has the down to earth, self-deprecating humor in her circumstances and multiple expressions, timing and art of slapstick that just makes one howl with laughter.JLD as "old" Christine Campbell is front and center, backed up with a magnificent ensemble cast that support and enhance JLD but are also each terrific in their own right and hysterically funny as well. Right up there is Hamish Linklater, who plays her nerdy brother Matthew, Clark Gregg, as supposedly ex (but always around) husband Richard, Emily Rutherford as his girlfriend, the "new Christine", hysterically funny Wanda Sykes as old Christine's best friend Barb, cute Trevor Gagnon as old Christine and Richard's son who is funny as the sacrificial lamb to his mother's neuroses and paranoia, and Tricia O'Kelley and Alex Kapp Horner as the "meanie moms" Marly and Lindsey, always one-upping Christine.One of my favorite episodes on Season Three is "Rock and a Hard Place" as Christine has just been dumped by boyfriend Daniel and Matthew visits a shrink as part of his therapist-in-training process. Won't divulge the rest but check it out, it has to be one of the funniest shows around, oh yes, and don't forget Christine's "looney laugh" in the beginning of that episode, you will absolutely roll on the floor with laughter.Also hysterically funny on Season Four is "One and a Half Men", with guest star and ex Seinfeld buddy Jason Alexander as Christine's gynecologist, who thinks she may be entering menopause. Barb recommends testosterone cream to tame the crazy Christine, and, well, what happens next is just howlingly funny. Won't spoil it for you, but you have to see it.Season Four is TNAOOC at its best, but, tell you the truth, EVERY episode in all five seasons is terrific. Can't really pick a favorite. I really hope that JLD could someday, somehow, bring this great ensemble back together again. No problem with audio, video, packaging, etc in the set. I don't think it is that pricey, as some reviewers have stated. Anyway, whenever I need a good laugh, TNAOOC can't be beat.
summary: WHY DID THEY CANCEL THIS SHOW??......
Title: N/A

reviewText: I have been disturbed by the prices of the NAOOC sets. These are priceless DVDs and it is criminal to just give them away. The should be like caviar or the most expensive wine. People should have achieved something in life and have accumulated great wealth so that they can display the series as a status symbol. 44 dollars for a single season is greatly underplaying their worth. I would suggest 400 hundred dollars a season as a starting point.
